class2.description: Rich brown ale perfect for the fall and winter. Plenty of malt character and smooth sweet finish give this brown ale its distinct character.

class2.name: Birthday Suit  24th Anniversary Sour Cherry
class2.description: Lightly sour blonde ale with Montmorency cherries.

class2.name: Spring Bock
class2.description: In Germany, this is a lager that is traditionally brewed in the Spring.Our Spring Bock is brilliant gold in color, brewed with authenticGerman malts, noble hops and Bavarian lager yeast. The wordbock means ‘goat’ in German and is used to describe beers with a kick.

class2.name: Felsina Berardenga Chianti Classico Riserva (375ML half-bottle) 2012
Victorville Red
class2.description: Bold caramel flavors balanced by copious late kettle additions of citrusy American hops.

class2.name: Sour Citrus Mystress
class2.description: This light and effervescent beer pops with tangy farmhouse character in the nose and continues on with a bright acidic bite on the palate. Citrus-forward American hops accompany the aromatic lemon and orange west added post-fermentation. A mineral quality is prominent throughout the profile with an extra dry finish.

class2.name: Jolly Tar
class2.description:
The Jolly Tar name is inspired by one of the famous rye whiskeys produced by the Altschul Distilling Co. founded in 1862 by Samuel Altschul Sr., an immigrant from Germany. The distillery was located in Springfield, O and featured more than a dozen brands, including Jolly Tar Rye. His flagship label was Old School Rye which was derived from the English translation of his last name Altschul. He styled this whiskey “pure and potent.” 

 

Jolly Tar is dark brown with ruddy highlights and has a subdued hop character with a mildly assertive finish. The aroma is malty with lots of baker’s chocolate and mild raisin-like notes. The aroma flows into the flavor of the beer with chocolate, raisin and fig like character. The mid palate is malty with medium body that finishes somewhat dry.

class2.name: Winter Blend
class2.description: Our winter offering starts with fresh apple cider. It is fermented with our ale yeast and aged on toasted oak chips, cinnamon bark, and nutmeg. Not overwhelming on the spice, Winter Blend finishes clean – with enough kick for a cold winter night.

class2.name: Atom Splitter
class2.description: A cross between a red ale and an IPA, this beer is hopped high with Amarillo and Citra hops. The mixture of the hops creates a floral bouquet of delectable citrus with an approachable bitterness.

class2.name: Freya's Stone Amber Ale
class2.description: Our Amber Ale is a slightly roasty, slightly caramely and deliciously malty take on American craft beer. We brew this with a 100% barley grain bill consisting of various Caramel roasts.  We use a generous amount of American hops for bittering and aroma without upsetting the balance of the beer. Truly a beer for all seasons, with a mix of great flavor and accessibility, you’ll love the change of pace from lighter beers.

class2.name: Shoofly Wheat Ale
class2.description: Equal parts of malted wheat and pale malt plus Sterling and Czech Saaz hops go into our simple refreshing summer ale.

class2.name: BROHIO
class2.description: Collaboration with North High Brewing. With prickly pear and Hibiscus.

class2.name: Bila-Haut by Michel Chapoutier Cotes du Roussillon Villages 2015
La Rioja Alta Vina Alberdi Reserva Tinto 2010
Domaine Reverdy Ducroux Beau Roy Sancerre 2016
Yardstick Ruth's Reach Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Charles Smith Chateau Smith Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Ambassador
class2.description:
The best of both brewing worlds: A hybrid Belgian-American strong pale ale with golden-copper color, medium body and maltiness, low caramel/toasty malt flavor, floral and citrus-like American-variety hops used to produce high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma
but some phenolic spiciness and high fruity esters from Belgian ale yeast.

class2.name: Oompa Loompa Chocolate Stout
class2.description: Our English Sweet Stout brewed with 22 pounds of Belgian bittersweet chocolate and aged with 10 pounds of cocoa nibs and Madagascar vanilla beans for a cold weather treat.

class2.name: Old World Hefeweizen
class2.description: Our German-style hefeweizen is an unfiltered wheat beer that is handcrafted using only pure imported Hallertauer German hops grown in the Hallertau region of Germany to give it an original old world taste!  With its white moussy long lasting head, golden color, subtle aroma of bananas, and light hoppy taste, our hefe gives a crisp refreshing taste with a nice balanced finish to make this a perfect everyday beer for everyone to enjoy!

class2.name: Big Oak
class2.description: A Vienna Lager brewed to the strength of a Bock.

class2.name: Domaine Diochon Moulin-a-Vent Cuvee Vieilles Vignes 2015
Notorious Pink Domaine La Colombette Rose 2016
Buzzcut Nut Brown Ale
class2.description: Brown ale brewed with honey and hazelnuts.

class2.name: Berkeley Hundred
class2.description: Scotch Ale fermented with fresh cranberries. This beer is the perfect compliment to the gorgeous fall weather we're currently experiencing: full bodied, slightly sweet and a bit tart. Berkeley Hundred is named for the estate in Virginia where the first Thanksgiving was held almost 400 years ago.

class2.name: Ramstein Blonde
class2.description: Unfiltered traditional German weiss beer. Malty wheat bouquet brimming with clove and apple aromas. Wheat and barley balanced by imported German Tettnanger hops. The finish is smooth and refreshing.

class2.name: Marques de Murrieta Capellania White Reserva 2011
Liquid Chords
class2.description: Brown ale with vanilla and cacao nibs and Vanilla Beans.

class2.name: Treeman ESB
class2.description: Classic malty English style ale.

class2.name: Hop Circle IPA
class2.description: Hoptimization capacitors activated. Taste probe functions optimal. Aroma sensors in overdrive. Engage. Let this otherworldly IPA abduct the hell out of your senses. The gravitational pull of Hop Circle will have you searching the galaxy for another close encounter of the thirst kind. Resistance is futile.

class2.name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Columbia Valley Riesling 2015
Corte dei Papi Cesanese del Piglio Colle Ticchio 2013
Java Porter
class2.description:
A medium-bodied ale with robust coffee aroma and flavor from the addition of coffee beans into the boil.

Local coffee roaster Partridge & Quigley’s Sumatran Blue Ling Tong coffee beans

class2.name: Aarghtoberfest
class2.description: Our AARGHtoberfest! is a rich and toasty lager with a color reminiscent of the fallen leaves of October. A subdued earthy hop character helps to balance this malt forward beer. This beer is only available from August through September.

class2.name: B Side Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Penalty Kick ESB
class2.description: An American-style ESB, this Extra Special Bitter comes in a ~7% with a great, malty body and a slight rye and hop bite.

class2.name: La Rioja Alta Vina Ardanza Reserva (375ML half-bottle) 2007
O-Town Brown Ale
class2.description: Moderately hopped with organic Golding hops, our English style Brown Ale has a toasty, nutty taste. This beer is slightly malty and contains notes of caramel and hints of chocolate.

class2.name: Battle Point Stout
class2.description:
THE BEER: A big, bold, dark, American Stout. Battle Point maintains a complex roastiness, with hints of caramel and chocolate, without being overly burnt or bitter. Smooth as silk and dark as night. ESB, Flaked Barley, Crystal 40, Chocolate malt, Black malt, Black barley, Carafa III, and just a hint of Extra Special malt. Hops are Nugget, Apollo and Willamette.

THE STORY: Located on the West side of the Island, Battle Point was supposedly named for a battle between a raiding northern tribe and the local Suquamish, in which Chief Kitsap and his men were victorious. During World War II, a radio post was established there as part of a network for intercepting and decoding Japanese radio transmissions. Now it's a park, and when I was a kid we used to shoot off model rockets there. Battle Point Stout is named after this historical corner of the island.

class2.name: Ha-Czech
class2.description: A well-balanced pilsner with a corn-like malt sweetness and complex spicy hop presence. Moderately bitter, without being aggressive, from the use of Saaz hops. Brewed with traditional ingredients to be as authentic as possible. Named after the legendary Dominik Hasek (The Dominator), Czech Republic born goaltender for the Buffalo Sabres and Detroit Red Wings. Show Less

class2.name: Bodegas Ramon Bilbao Limited Edition Rioja 2013
Superpest Double IPA
class2.description:
BRONZE MEDAL WINNER - IMPERIAL IPAS -  BC BEER AWARDS 2014!

"Lead by example" is no forced cliche to the Superpest - it's an innate ethic.  In the bottle, that directive is deftly delivered by the great Centennial, Chinnok, and Columbus hops of the Pacific Northwest.  Only BC-malted 2-row barley is good enough to echo the Superpest name, so that's what we use...

class2.name: Maison L'Envoye Two Messengers Pinot Noir 2014
Marzën
class2.description: German Spring Lager aged to perfection brewed with 2 Row Barley, Crystal, Victory and Munich Malts. Has an amber complexion with caramel and roasted characteristics and a fairly dry finish. This higher gravity lager is named after the month of March when most brewers made this beer.

class2.name: Bully! Porter
class2.description: The intense flavors of dark-roasted malt in Boulevard’s rendition of the classic English porter are perfectly balanced by a generous and complex hop character. Bully! Porter’s robust nature makes it the ideal companion to a variety of foods, from seafood to chocolate.

class2.name: Miguel Torres Las Mulas Organically Grown Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva 2014
Hop Project 07270
class2.description:
A single hopped pale ale / IPA hybrid brewed and dry hopped with a new experimental high alpha hop variety, known simply at this point by its hop breeding program number, 07270. 

Derived from a parentage of citrusy Apollo hops & more earthy English Target. Try it out along with us and let us know what flavor and aroma characteristics you discern.

class2.name: Qualifier IPA
class2.description: Qualifier IPA is a a well balanced IPA with hints of pine and citrus

class2.name: Sieban Larger
class2.description: A full bodied, malt-accentuated amber lager, best described as Biergarten Marzen. Double decocted from German Pilsner, Vienna and Munich malts with several kettle additions of Nobel hops. We have re-worked this family favorite many times over the years and of the 20 or so recipes created it was "number seven or Sieben” in German that was selected by our diverse tasting panel as the best of the best.

class2.name: Domaine Lafage La Grand Cuvee Rose 2014
Mother Pucker
class2.description: Sour witbier with blueberries

class2.name: Andromeda IPA
class2.description: Hoppy, citrusy, with notes of passion fruit and other tropical fruits. An East Coast style India Pale Ale that is smooth and well balanced, with an intense hop aroma and an emphasis on hop taste, combined with a moderate bitterness.

class2.name: Tallboy Hop Harvest Brown Ale
class2.description: A strong Brown Ale brewed with freshly picked whole Cluster hops and wildflower honey.  The result is a beer bursting with malt flavor and resiny hop goodness.  This is a collaborative brew between the brewmasters of Market Garden Brewery, Rocky River Brewery, and Indigo Imp and will be featured at all Cleveland Beer Week events.

class2.name: Schwarzbier
class2.description: German lager built on pilsner base malt and a few specialty malts, made black with Midnight Wheat malt. Hopped with Hallertau and fermented with the Weihenstephan 206 strain.

class2.name: Bretticent Wild Ale
class2.description: This traditional saison is brewed using North Carolina grown barley, wheat, and rye from Riverbend Malthouse and is open fermented. The beer is then finished with Brettanomyces.

class2.name: G-Mac's
class2.description: G-Mac’s Celtic Style Pale Ale is a crisp ale with a citrusy bite and just a hint of sweetness for that perfect balance of flavors. At 5.0 percent alcohol by volume and 30 IBUs, G-Mac’s is drinkable, yet satisfying. And its floral hop flavor provides a snappy finish that’s perfect on the course or in the clubhouse.

class2.name: Sur de los Andes Malbec Cabernet Sauvignon Premium Blend 2010
Free Day IPA
class2.description: Free Day IPA is brewed once a year to celebrate Independence Day. Each year, this beer is brewed with a new recipe. This time around, our brewers dry hopped Free Day with Perle, Hallertauer and Fuggle, hops not normally used in IPA. Be Free!

class2.name: 80 SHILLING
class2.description: Our 80 Shilling is deep red in color and very malt accented. Very little hop flavor or aroma is evident. It is basically our Scottish Ale’s little sister. This ale is lower in alcohol than the Scottish Ale. To give this beer caramel flavor, Our Brewmaster took a portion of the first runnings of wort and transferred it to the kettle.The Brewmaster then boiled these runnings for an hour to caramelize and reduce the wort. This gave the beer a nice caramel flavor. Scottish breweries list their products in ascending order of gravity and strength as Light, Heavy, Export                                  and Strong. In the past, beer in Scotland was taxed based on strength, so the                                      beers became known by their tax ratings: 60 shilling, 70 shilling, 80 shilling, 90                                    shilling. Alcohol content by volume might rise through 3, 4, 4.5 and 7-10.

class2.name: 31 Kings
class2.description: This IPA is set apart from others by the beer's powerful aroma that is flowery and herbal with hints of lemon and notes of passion fruit. 31 Kings has a balance of slight caramel malty sweetness that combines with an intense yet rolling bitterness profile. This also sets our IPA apart from others which focus on a punch in the face of hops rather than a harmony of bitterness and flavor. Finally, flavors of pine and orange trickle into the aftertaste allowing a clean and refreshing finish.

class2.name: Hopitoulas
class2.description: West Coast style India Pale Ale that combines 6 malts and 6 hops with additional dry hopping for three weeks. It takes about a month and a half to make each batch and we think it is worth the wait. Hints of pine and citrus with a powerful, yet balanced hoppy flavor, Hopitoulas packs a punch that you won’t forget.

class2.name: Good Question
class2.description: What do you call a hybrid between a British pale ale and an American pale ale...good question! Marris Otter gives this beer a toasty base. American hops  and English yeast finish out the ale to give it a perfect blend of tosty malts and clean hop bite.

class2.name: Father
class2.description: Father’s home, and his big, brawny body fills the room with a ruddy glow. He brings us gifts of dark roasted malts with hints of caramel and nuts, and bitter Belma hops that conjure up strawberries and plums. We promise we’ll save some for later. But he knows we won’t.

class2.name: 10th Anniversary Ale
class2.description: This pale is highlighted by the spicy hop character of German Tettnang and the piney citrus notes of American Cascade. Light in body with a dry finish

class2.name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 50th Anniversary Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
DAMPF LOC - Neue Welt Hefe Gerste
class2.description:
Dampf Loc is an all-barley warm fermented ale brewed by the folks from Chicago’s Local Option; inspired by “Dampfbier” originally crafted by medieval peasant inhabitants of the Bavarian Forest.  During the fermentation process generous amounts of foam and surface bubbles burst in the tank, giving the illusion that the ferment is boiling or “steaming.”  Local Option took up the task of brewing Dampf Loc as a modern interpretation of its Teutonic predecessor, creating a “Hefe Gerste” ale that is true to its roots; unmistakable in character yet accessible to beer drinkers of all palates.

Dampf Loc has a mild hop profile, medium body with pleasant effervescence and a clear, rich, orange hue.  Dampf Loc is ideal for warm months, yet enjoyable year round.

class2.name: Thoroughbred
class2.description: Bourbon Barrel Aged Kentucky Common

class2.name: Robert Mondavi Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Mer Soleil Santa Lucia Highlands Reserve Chardonnay 2014
Taken Wine Company Complicated Pinot Noir 2015
RYE FACTOR RED
class2.description: A deep copper colored ale w/ medium body & bitterness, subtle smoked flavors from the use of cherrywood smoked malt

class2.name: 13 Rebels ESB
class2.description: French Broad Brewery’s interpretation of the classic UK Extra Special Bitter. A bright copper color with a complex malt palate is complemented by traditional British hops, notably East Kent Golding. French Broad has made this traditional public house session beer a cult favorite with its skull and crossbones artwork.

class2.name: 20th Anniversary Experimental IPA
class2.description: This refreshing session ale delivers citrus and pine notes from unique experimental hops. Two decades strong and we taste mighty fresh. Cheers to 20 years of Victory!

class2.name: Harmonie Dark Lager
class2.description:
This beer is based on the very first comercially brewed beer in the state of Indiana.

The name of the brewer was George Bentel. His house is still standing in New Harmony.  The Harmonist brewer and cooper, George Bentel, was born November 3, 1781 in Iptingen, the same village in the Swabian kingdom of Württemberg where George Rapp was born.  Bentel lived at the northeast corner of Brewery and Grainery streets, where his house remains today, as upright as when Indiana's first brewer marched out to make his beer almost two centuries ago.
The German utopian communalists in New Harmony were Indiana's first significant brewers. Beginning in 1816, the Harmonists eventually brewed enough to sell all the way up to what is now West Virginia and down into lower Illinois. From the historical record, it appears the Harmonists brewed a porter-like dark beer. It must have been pretty good beer: An educated German, Ferdinand Ernst, stopped in New Harmony during his journey through the frontier region. “They served me a stein of beer,” Ernst wrote, “and I was not a little astonished to find here a genuine, real Bamberg beer.” He gushed that the Harmonists “must be happiest people of entire Christiandom.” A Louisville agent for the Harmonists reported, “Mr. Breeden, the most celebrated porter seller in the place says the strongest part of it would almost pass for porter and is the best beer he has ever seen in this country…

class2.name: Roots Run Deep Educated Guess Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Delas Cotes du Rhone St. Esprit Rouge 2014
Piece of Cake - Dessert Stout
class2.description: This elegantly delicious sweet stout was created to be the perfect dessert beer. We age our chocolate milk stout on freshly ground coffee, Madagascar vanilla beans, and toasted coconut to represent a similar flavor experience to a German Chocolate Cake. When you find yourself looking for something different, grab a Piece of Cake!

class2.name: Scenic Root Winegrowers Textbook Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Domaines Bunan Bandol Mas de la Rouviere Rose 2015
CASK CONDITIONED BEHIND ABBEY DOORS WITH RASPBERRIES
class2.description: Brewmaster Brian took our Belgian Brown Ale, Behind Abbey Doors, and put it in a firkin with a bunch of fresh red raspberries. Traditionally served using gravity, this cask conditioned ale is a smooth, rare treat.

class2.name: Space Train
class2.description: They legally wouldn't let us open a brewery unless we brewed an IPA. Five varieties of American hops give this session-ish IPA a fruity aroma and balanced bitterness.

class2.name: Due South Category 3 (Cat 3)
class2.description:
Brewed with loads of malts and loads of hops, this golden India Pale Ale is true to the style while maintaining a balance between malty and bitter.  A special blend of American  hops give this beer its unique flavor.  Although fruity and citrusy, this beer has only four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and water.  

Interesting Fact: This is the first beer Mike ever entered in a homebrew competition and it received an award that day. It was at Havana Hideout in Lake Worth, FL.

class2.name: Desperados Red
class2.description: Red is the beer that lifts you up to keep you in the mood for partying, an energetic combination of beer, tequila and guarana.

class2.name: Commanderie de Peyrassol Cotes de Provence Rose 2016
Saintsbury Vincent Vin Gris Pinot Noir Rose 2016
Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Urbock
class2.description: A smoked bock beer for Bamberg's strong beer season (October through December). Matured for months in ancient rock-cellars underneath Bamberg and tapped freshly from the oakwood cask. Similar to, but much bigger than the classic Maerzen style.

class2.name: Crimson Ridge Vintage Dry
class2.description: In the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains at Wintergreen, Virginia is a cidery overlooking the Rockfish River.  Here a custom blend of Virginia apples is crafted to make a premium hard cider with a rounded, full-bodied apple taste.  Rich and beautifully effervescent, Crimson Ridge is exceptionally well-balanced, bringing out the very best in Virginia apples.

class2.name: Bodegas Ontanon Viura Vetiver Rioja Blanco 2014
Domaine de Fontsainte Corbieres Gris de Gris 2016
Kendall-Jackson Jackson Estate Santa Maria Valley Chardonnay 2014
Windy Oaks Terra Narro Estate Pinot Noir 2014
Hopped Up Red Ale
class2.description: This amber ale is medium-bodied with low bitterness and has a nice hop punch. Brewed with organic malts.

class2.name: Sparky
class2.description:
Our garage was a pretty crowded space. Toys, tools, brewing equipment, and even the family sedan when we could fit it in. Probably no different than your garage. So with space at a premium, there was no room for junk. Everything had to perform. Like that pair of jumper cables over there. When we need them, they get the job done, providing a spark to start something fresh, something new, shared among family, friends, even a stranger in need. So here’s to providing a spark when called upon, no matter who needs it. That’s why we call this this hoppy wheat ale Sparky. And always remember, red to positive.

Sparky Hoppy Wheat Ale is a true-to-style American wheat beer. Unlike the common German Hefeweizen which features banana and clove yeast aromas and flavors, this beer features a clean American ale yeast. This single Cascade hop brewed beer focuses on being hop forward with a nice malt background support the hops and keep the beer well-balanced. This hop is citrus and pine forward. Sparky finishes dry, clean and crisp.

class2.name: The Cream Ale
class2.description: This easy drinking beer is smooth and creamy. It is well balanced with a low to medium body and medium hop profile

class2.name: M. Chapoutier Cotes du Rhone Belleruche Rose 2015
Winter Ale
class2.description: Brewed for the holidays AND beyond! This beer is lightly spiced and warming, which will keep you cozy all winter.

class2.name: 6th Generation Stock Ale
class2.description: Stock ales were once common among America’s family run breweries. 6th Generation Stock Ale features a unique blend of  malts and  the finest  hops from the Pacific Northwest.  Then we finish  in the hopjack for the signature hop flavor. 44 IBUs and our special milling and endosperm mashing process make for a smooth and refreshing ale.

class2.name: Michael David Winery Freakshow Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Hefeweizen
class2.description: There is no Oktoberfest without Hefeweizen. Brewed with classic German ingredients, our take on this style is loaded with banana esters and hints of clove producing a flavorful and highly drinkable wheat beer.

class2.name: Petite Verdot
class2.description: Coming at you live from the mean streets of Bordeaux France is Petit Verdot Grand Gose, an oversized Gose that is designed specifically around its namesake fruit. At first glance the densely opaque violet appearance of the beer hints at a potential fruity potpourri, however; Petit Verdot proves to be more than the uninspired fruity beers being pushed down your throats like bad pop music. Utilizing a grape that most often makes up smaller percentages of wine blends in France, we extract massive leathery notes, hints of tobacco, heavy beats of beets, delicate tannins, jammy notes of raspberries and boysenberries, and then finally a very effervescent cranberry-like finish. A small mountain of French sea salt aids in turning the volume up on the intricate Petit Verdot grape profile and bridging it to the beer's tart and sour base. Petit Verdot Grand Gose is a rare breed; bright and refreshing on its finish making it easy to throw back pints repeatedly, but also a wealth of complexity that can be slowly sipped and analyzed as if you were studying for your Sommelier exam.

class2.name: Freixenet Sparkling Cordon Negro Brut Cava
GINGER
class2.description: A medium-dry cider infused with fresh organic ginger root. Festively spiced, with a clean lemony finish.

class2.name: Montepulciano Kolsch
class2.description: Indigenous to Italy, and brought to us by the Orsi Family in Dry Creek, Montepulciano is a varietal that has a deep ruby color and produces a juice with a soft flavors reminiscent of plum jam. Blended with a light Kolsch ale and refermented in oak.

class2.name: Imperial Dortmunder
class2.description: An imperial golden lager balanced between malt sweetness and dry hop flavors, yet darker in color and richer in finish. Brewed specially in 2008 to celebrate GLBC's 20th Anniversary.

class2.name: Migration Russian River Pinot Noir (375ML half-bottle) 2014
fľaša svetlé pivo
class2.description:
12% svetlé pivo Zlatý Bažant je svetlý ležiak plzenského typu.


Je charakteristické jemnou chmeľovou arómou a stredne silnou horkosťou. Plná chuť a primeraná rezkosť ho zaraďujú medzi najobľúbenejšie pivá na trhu.

 Je hlavným nosným sortimentom pivovaru Zlatý Bažant, známym takmer na celom svete. Elegantná etiketa a zlatou šatôčkou obalené hrdlo špeciálnej zelenej fľaše dáva produktu skutočný ráz exkluzivity.

class2.name: L'Abondance
class2.description: Peppery Saison yeast meets floral, citrusy hops. Dry hopped to add a juicy character to this classic farmhouse style.

This Ale is truly American. It is a West-Coast original. This style of beer was originally developed in San Francisco, where the air was cool enough to substitute for refrigeration. It is an improvisation of a beer developed as early as the Gold Rush days. One sip, and you'll think you've struck gold!

class2.name: Saison Vert
class2.description: Saison Vert is an open fermented wheat based brew made with black limes, giving the otherwise bright beer a darker flavor profile. Layered with spice, citrus, earth, and even walnut notes, Saison Vert goes down easily with tremendous nuance. Several kegs will see out of state distribution, so look for both locally and across the country.

class2.name: Roggen
class2.description: A German-style rye beer. Medium-bodied, deep amber in color, with a classically spicy finish.

class2.name: White Lightning
class2.description: 2012 GABF Bronze Medalist.  This Belgian-Style White Ale combines a complex malt character with sweet orange peel, coriander and grains of paradise.  The end result is a shockingly refreshing wheat beer that can be enjoyed all year long.

class2.name: Georgetown Braggot
class2.description: Our version of this less-than-famous style of mead is technically a bottle-conditioned ale using local blackberry honey. We add Northern Brewer hops and ferment it with a Belgian yeast strain. The malt bill includes Munich, Pilsner and Special B malts.

class2.name: Crackberry
class2.description: Cranberry & blackberry – stripped of all other nonsense. Crackberry is a perfect pairing of flavors tart and sweet, joining forces to create a colorful, well-balanced cider. Frankly, we’re over the moon for it.

class2.name: Bodegas Ramirez de la Piscina Reserva 2011
Lord Rear Admiral
class2.description: Three Floyds version of an ESB, this deep amber ale has a complex malt sweetness and pronounced apricot hoppiness. Named after Admiral Lord Horatio Nelson.

class2.name: English Nut Brown
class2.description: St. George Nut Brown Ale is a classic English-style Brown Ale with flavors reminiscent of biscuit and caramel that is well balanced by a mild hop character. This beer was traditionally served in taverns as their house beer. Our Nut Brown Ale is light brown in color with a thick creamy head.

class2.name: Hyena
class2.description: A Belgian pale ale brewed with American hops and fermented with Chouffe yeast.

class2.name: All Time Favorite Gift Cookie Tin
class2.description:
There's nothing we like better than cookies! Eighteen delicious cookies come packed in a reusable tin. This gift is sure to please anyone on your list.

Gift Includes:
  • Chocolate-Covered Sandwich Cookies (18)

class2.name: The Red C
class2.description:
This is Sloop Brewing’s bold aggressive beer. The Red C contains three different hop varieties that begin with the letter “C”.  The beer has a deep red hue and stands at 6.7% abv.  

Red C pours with a crimson red color and an effervescent white head.  The complex malt flavor comes from a variety of finely kilned grains.  The American hops provide the beer with hints of lemon, mango and citrus flavors.  The clean ale yeast allows your palate to correctly identify all of these complex flavors.

class2.name: Chateau St. Jean North Coast Chardonnay 2014
Dirty Little Freak
class2.description: Dirty Little Freak Coconut Caramel Chocolate Brown Ale is medium-bodied, 6% abv and a feast for the senses from its dominant blend of warm roasted malt, coconut, caramel, and chocolate flavors and aromas, barely restrained by a gentle hop bite, to a tantalizingly satisfying finish.

class2.name: Codorniu Anna de Codorniu Cava Brut
The Wine Aroma Wheel
class2.description:
Did you know that as much as 80 percent of what we perceive as "taste" is actually smell? Novice wine tasters often find it difficult to translate into words the things they smell in a wine. Fortunately, it is very easy to train our noses and brains to connect and quickly link terms with aromas.

The UC Davis Wine Aroma Wheel, developed by A.C. Noble, is made of three tiers: it has very general terms located in the center (e.g. fruity or chemical), going to the most specific terms in the outer tier (e.g. grapefruit or strawberries). It's an extremely useful tool to learn about wines and enhance one's ability to describe the complexity of wine flavor.

class2.name: MacMurray Ranch Russian River Pinot Noir 2014
Yearling Flanders Red Ale
class2.description: An American sour ale in the Flanders Red style. Aged in wine barrels for a year, this tart and complex beer has aromas of plum and sour cherry, with flavors of ripe fruit and subtle caramel malt. Dry and refreshing with an oaky finish.

class2.name: Winter Ale
class2.description: Winter spiced ale is our winter seasonal offering. With it's thick body, creamy head, ruby hue, and big bold flavors with hints of caramel, toffee, and cinnamon, it is sure to keep you warm through the cold winter nights. Best served at 56ºf in a snifter glass.

class2.name: Cape May Richie’s Rad Pale Ale
class2.description: ABV: 5.4% SRM 4.4 IBU 58 Dryer than dry with a hop stickiness that coats your mouth, with a lingering grapefruit bitterness that accentuates the dryness leaving you thirsty for more, this Pale Ale defines being rad. Continuing our Employee Series, if you’ve had a conversation with our sales guy Richie you’ll know why we named this Rad - as invariably within minutes he’s referred to something as being "rad." Richie wanted a rad beer that was crushable and bursting at the seams with tropical notes and hoppy dankness, and with spring in full swing you’re reaching for a brew that’ll let you pound back a few rounds. Begging for a couple go-to’s, Richie’s Rad Pale Ale is one you’re going to put back with ease.

class2.name: FAT UNICORN PALE ALE
class2.description: Medium-bodied, balanced pale ale.  Citrus, herbal, minty hop aroma.  Toasty, biscuit malt character.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Clean finished.  Balanced.

class2.name: Shiner Wild Hare Pale Ale
class2.description: Wild Hare is a classic American Pale Ale-richly hopped, fruity and floral. Munich malt nicely balances the assertive character of the U.S. Golding and Bravo hop varieties that give this brew its signature bitterness and aroma. Enjoy!

class2.name: Newman's Bitter
class2.description: English Extra Special Bitter. Caramel sweetness balanced with Cluster and East Kent Golding hops. Very Smooth with a copper color.

class2.name: Chronic Cellars Sofa King Bueno Red Blend 2015
Shucker Stout
class2.description:
Shucker Stout is dark and full of complex roasted/coffee/chocolate flavors. It’s brewed to ferment very completely to result in a dry and easy drinking finish. This stout is not motor oil. It won’t make you feel full after drinking just one but still carries a full spectrum of flavors and complexity. Shucker Stout is technically classified as a Dry Stout and, at just over 5% ABV, is light enough to enjoy over and over again.
 That all sounds great, but… Shucker Stout? Heck ya! Oysters are the most classic example of food pairings with Stout and the Chesapeake Bay is world famous for our oysters. A shucker is the term for the person who opens oysters as well as the name of the knife used to do the job. So there you go, Shucker Stout! Enjoy!

class2.name: Barre Blonde
class2.description: Crisp golden ale

class2.name: Arterberry Maresh Dundee Hills Pinot Noir 2014
Spring Bock
class2.description:
A traditional German style lager. Characterized by a deep copper color and rich malt flavor. Balanced with German hops.

Available at the Brewery and in bottles & cases from March - May.

class2.name: Clelia Romano Colli di Lapio Fiano di Avellino 2015
Jolly Folly IPA
class2.description: Boldly hoppy, just like the award-winning craft beers the brewery is renowned for, the seasonal offering was created when a newer team member committed a ‘folly’ by mistakenly mixing two different beer tanks, resulting in 500 barrels (or 15,500 gallons!) of the merry new brew. A taste of the resulting batch revealed it to be delicious, a hop bomb with a winter spice flavor. It’s Green Flash’s unexpected gift to IPA enthusiasts this holiday season. Jolly Folly is dominated by resinous, spicy hops. Its piney, floral aroma yields to a full malty flavor that is nicely balanced by multiple layers of citrus and tropical hop flavors.

class2.name: Coconut Hiwa Porter
class2.description: Brewed with a carefully crafted malt bill comprised of seven different varieties of malted barley, this dark ale is sure to please even the most discerning of drinkers.  Look for a silky mouthfeel and notes of roasted malt, dark cacao and coffee. The addition of in-house hand toasted coconut lends a delightful and distinct tropical aroma that carries through into the flavor.  Cascade hops are used to temper the sweetness and lend a spicy yet subdued complexity.

class2.name: Rip City Red
class2.description: For people who love IPAs but like a little more malt sweetness. We use American 2-row, Munich, Carapils, Crystal-15 and Crystal-120, and a little chocolate malt to add some oomph. We then throw in Palisade, Amarillo, and Centennial hops for a balanced, drinkable beer.

class2.name: Hoptree IPA
class2.description: With 11 different hops and a malty foundation, this IPA unleashes bold flavor.  The grassy, tangerine aroma leads into a bright mix of citrus and lemongrass, with a fleeting bitter finish.

class2.name: Sella & Mosca Cannonau di Sardegna Riserva 2012
Cherry Bomb
class2.description: A blend of our award winning hard cider, made with Michigan tart cherries and lemon to create a refreshing adult cherry lemonade.

class2.name: Bonny Doon Vin Gris de Cigare 2016
Global Warmer
class2.description: ...how did we end up in this situation? Plenty of blame to go around for sure, but we're going to have to formulate our way out of this mess. Beer climates change, seasons creep but the liquid must remain cyc. Hey man, it is all about the %*@#ing formulation. Now that's Mad Science.

class2.name: Antinori Guado al Tasso Il Bruciato 2014
Blue Testament
class2.description: Crisp, light, with a sweetness brought in by the Texas-sourced blue corn, this beer is perfect for daily drinking and taking to your favorite summer body of water.

class2.name: Dry Creek Vineyard Dry Chenin Blanc 2016
Riedel O - Set of 2 Champagne Glasses
class2.description:
This Riedel glass series has something missing; there is no stem or base. Riedel O is the innovative take on the wine tumbler, the designs of which are based on the benchmark shapes of the Riedel Vinum. These are the ideal glasses for every day use and for every occasion; they are fun and feel good to hold.

The Riedel O series is a lead free machine blown series and is dishwasher safe.The Riedel O Champagne glass is ideally suited to showcase the best characteristics of Cava, Champagne, Cuvée Prestige, Prosecco, Rosé Champagne, Sparkling wine, Vintage Champagne.

Tumblers hold 8 7/8 oz and stand 4 7/8" high.

Sold in a boxed set of 2.

Wine sold separately.

See other Riedel O tumbler sizes and styles

Promotional code discounts do not apply to this product.

class2.name: Fünke Hop Farm
class2.description: Who's got the fünke? This farmhouse style fünke saison certainly does; a unique blend of barrel-aged brew made in locally sourced Petite Syrah and Grenache wine barrels. Carefully crafted with a final round of dry-hopping to bring out the distinct notes of citrus and stone fruit. Enjoy with good company and savor the fünke. Prost!

class2.name: Idlewild The Bee Flora and Fauna White 2016
Palazzone Orvieto Classico Campo del Guardiano 2012
Haraszthy Family Cellars Old Vine Zinfandel 2015
Papa Noel's Olde Ale
class2.description: This holiday ale was brewed in the English 'old ale' style, a traditional strong ale style that is sometimes called a 'winter warmer.' The warmth comes from the alcoholic strength of the beer, which weighs in at about 7.2% by volume. It is an attractive dark copper-brown hue and is extremely full-bodied. Papa Noel's has a pleasing sweetness from its higher-than-normal alcoholic content, and from its complex malt foundation.This sweetness is balanced by a hint of roasted flavor, as well as a mellow bitterness imparted by a generous amount of English Fuggle hops. Other flavors in evidence are bittersweet chocolate, caramel, and toffee. Papa Noel's Olde Ale is the perfect brew to warm the body and nourish the soul during the cold and wet holiday season. Cheers!

class2.name: Concha y Toro Terrunyo Sauvignon Blanc 2016
Resolute
class2.description: This obsidian-colored stout pushed the capacity of our mash tun to the limits with its huge grain bill! It looks like a one-pint espresso shot; black, strong, weighty and rich, but perfectly balanced.

class2.name: Saint Dekkera Reserve Sour: Flanders Oud Bruin
class2.description: Our Saint Dekkera® Reserve Sour Ales are naturally soured by spontaneous/wild secondary fermentation and aging in oak barrels with microflora wonderfully unique to our downstate Illinois terroir, where we embrace the individual, wild character of each barrel to produce beers with a wide array of acidity, sourness and unadulterated funkiness.

class2.name: MacMurray Ranch Central Coast Pinot Noir 2014
Chateau Ste. Michelle Columbia Valley Chardonnay 2015
Pale Ale
class2.description: This classic American Pale Ale is floral to the nose and flavorful to the mouth.  2-Row & 5 Specialty Malts create subtle caramel tones while just the slap right amout of cascade hops make our Pale Ale just a shade short of perfect.  Grab some and tell us what you think.  Surely to be one of your favorites.

class2.name: Green & Red Tip Top Vineyard Zinfandel 2013
Shannon Ridge Home Ranch Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Antebellum Ale
class2.description: An 1840?s American recipe using water, yeast, molasses, ginger and spruce tips. The ingredients from the historical drink have been adapted into a flavorful modern day beer incorporating malt and hops.

class2.name: Mosh Pit
class2.description: Hoppy Red Ale.

class2.name: Hefeweizen
class2.description: A lightly hopped, refreshing, Bavarian style wheat ale that has hints of banana and clove in the finish. Typically available May until October.

class2.name: Standing Stones
class2.description: A very malty scotch ale with a slight smokiness.

class2.name: Clos du Bois North Coast Merlot 2015
Dry Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (375ML half-bottle) 2013
Shannon Ridge Buck Shack Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Pomegranate Planet
class2.description: Pomegranate Planet – Our Spring seasonal American Wheat beer infused with the distinctive flavor of real pomegranate!

class2.name: Stir Crazy
class2.description: A new season means new adventures. We created Stir Crazy Winter Ale to warm you from within during the coldest time of year. Our sturdy winter warmer is brewed with cocoa nibs, vanilla, raisins and brown sugar. Layers of malty goodness create a dark ruby color and satisfying notes of chocolate and rich caramel, while pulverized raisins and brown sugar provide a fruity complexity. Bundle up and enjoy!

class2.name: Red Head
class2.description: This beer is a blonde that is made with four different malts including Rye. Hopped with Amarillo and fresh raspberries to provide further complexities and nuances.

class2.name: Terlato Family Vineyards Friuli Pinot Grigio 2015
Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling 2015
Chateau Durand Laplagne  Puisseguin-St. Emilion (Futures Pre-Sale) 2015
Sweet Myrtle - Side Trail Series
class2.description: Sweet Myrtle was chosen as the winner of the 15 Beers for 15 Years Competition at Upland Brewing Company’s 15th Anniversary. What began as a brewer’s desire to make a non-traditional ale turned into a crowd favorite. Sweet Myrtle celebrates both an anniversary and the passion we have for making great beer as seen through our Side Trail Series. Cheers!

class2.name: Bila-Haut by Michel Chapoutier Cotes du Roussillon Villages 2014
Locations by Dave Phinney F-4 Red
Four Vines Lodi Old Vine Zinfandel 2014
Mosaic IPA
class2.description:
This is not your average IPA.  From the incredible nose, to the amazing finish, this IPA is one that both session drinkers and beer nerds alike will love.
﻿
We’re full on board the hopwagon with this big American-style IPA.  However, it is not designed to blow your head off with overpowering hop bitterness.  Instead, Mosaic IPA is an extremely well-balanced brew that showcases its unique hop aroma and flavor.
​
This beer gets its name from a new hop variety named “Mosaic,” which is predominantly where the immense, raw hop aroma and flavor is derived.  Mosaic IPA has a noticeable malt backbone to help soften the high level of hop bitterness and flavor, while keeping the body fairly light.
﻿
The word "Mosaic" is also representative of the diverse range of individuals that make up our community.  It's perfect in every way!

class2.name: Stoneface Porter
class2.description: Everybody's got their thing. For some, it's campfires, music, unwinding. For others it's about breaking a sweat; a hike, a run, a ride. Some people want an absurdly hoppy IPA while others go for rich dark ales. Some choose all of the above - and that's how we roll. Do your thing; try new things; repeat. And try a Stoneface. We think you'll like that thing, too.

class2.name: Patz & Hall Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (375ML half-bottle) 2014
Spelt It, Dealt It
class2.description: A farmhouse ale brewed with 50% spelt wheat and Czech Saaz hops!

class2.name: Black Stallion Winery Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Seven Hills Winery Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Winter Run
class2.description: A hop forward, medium bodied, India Pale Ale.  The strong hop flavor is from the use of the choicest Pacific Northwest hops; lending to a balanced bitterness of citrus, floral, and hints of tropical fruit characteristics.

class2.name: Dr. Konstantin Frank Semi Dry Riesling 2015
The Federalist Zinfandel Bourbon Barrel Aged 2014
Charles Smith Kung Fu Girl Riesling 2015
Amber
class2.description: Loaded with caramel flavors, fruity esters and a hint of toasted malts. Full enough for those snappy spring days, while finishing with a clean bitterness that refreshes on the warm ones.

class2.name: Olivier Leflaive Bourgogne Blanc Les Setilles 2014
Domaine du Somail Minervos Vin de Plume 2014
Columbia Crest Grand Estates Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Nøgne  Saison
class2.description: One of our most refreshing brews, made for those hot summer days, but satisfying year 'round. Recommended serving temperature 8Ã?Â°C/45Ã?Â°F. Goes well with seafood, particularly oysters.

class2.name: Milk Stout
class2.description: Dark chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt aromas and flavors characterize this Stout providing silky, smooth warmth for the winter season. This Milk Stout is the result of the Collaborator project, a project between the Oregon Brew Crew (one of the oldest home brewing clubs in the nation) and Widmer Brothers that identifies unique beer styles for distribution to the public.

class2.name: Claim Jumper IPA
class2.description: A classic American IPA made with classic American ingredients. A blend of Columbus, Nugget and Galena provide a firm, bitter base that bears the full load of piney, grassy notes and deep hop flavors you expect from an IPA. The rocky, white head helps loft all those wonderful aromas right up to your snooter – so drink up!

class2.name: Summer Bock
class2.description: Rich in flavor from German pale barley. Moderate noble hop character with a subtle spicy quality from hops and alcohol. German Lager yeast provides a smooth long clean finish that interplays the malt and noble hops.

class2.name: Aglianico Kolsch
class2.description: Aglianico is a red wine grape thought to be one of the oldest varietals and brought to Italy by the ancient Greeks. Cultivated in the small quantities by the Orsi Family in Dry Creek, this spicy and tannic fruit blends well with our soft Global Kolsch.

class2.name: Workingman's Rye Stout
class2.description: An old fashioned stout with lots of flaked barley, roasted barley & rye malt, perfectly balanced by nugget and perle hops.

class2.name: Rising Rainbow Pale Ale
class2.description: A light crisp pale ale, lightly hopped and malted makes for a great spring Pale

class2.name: Powder Run Pale
class2.description: A hop forward American Pale Ale with big citrus flavor and aroma

class2.name: Angry Amber
class2.description: A low gravity, Amber Ale focusing on hops rather than malt contribution. Simcoe and Cascade make up the Hop Bill on this brew.

class2.name: French Saison
class2.description: Created and brewed as a traditional saison, this beer utilizes a powerful French saison yeast that rips through fermentation, creating a bright effervescent beer. With aromas of light fruit and hops, the flavor moves into a crisp and clean, lightly funky area, finishing with a touch of hop bitterness.

class2.name: King's Schilling
class2.description: Hand crafted and meticulously aged in oak, King's Shilling Brandy Barrel Cider is fortified with apple brandy made by Fremont Mischief Distillery.

class2.name: Olivier Leflaive Bourgogne Blanc Les Setilles 2015
Saison
class2.description: An award winning homebrew recipe by Bob Hall and our Pro-Am entry to the 2013 GABF.  A Saison brewed with demerara sugar.  Dry, fruity with some spice character.

class2.name: White Oak Wit
class2.description: Brewed for summers in Houston, this is a beautifully made version of a classic Belgian Witbier. Using wheat malt as the base, coriander and orange peel are added late in the boil. The result is a hazy beer that is light in body, and citrusy with some spicy notes.

class2.name: Evil Eye
class2.description: Amber in color but a style of its own

class2.name: Celilo CDA
class2.description: A dark ale hopped with Summit, Chinook and Tomahawk with a malt backbone of Midnight Wheat.

class2.name: Silver Bay IPA
class2.description:
Tucked away at the south end of Sitka's road system, you'll find Silver Bay. Abundant marine life and the impressive sheer face of Bear Mountain make it especially photogenic. Soon after the brewery opened, a rough and tumble bunch of girls who work at a fish processing plant on Silver Bay came in for samples and noticed our IPA was not yet named. They recommended Silver Bay IPA then attempted to wipe out our supply.

Also rough and tumble, our IPA is hoppy with plenty of flavor.

class2.name: Baker Lane Sonoma Coast Cuvee Syrah 2014
Hefe
class2.description: This American style Hefe is brewed with two row base malt, malted, and flaked wheat, with a light hop addition in the finish.  Fermented with an American Hefeweizen strain to bring a fruity, spicy nose.

class2.name: Freixenet Sparkling Cordon Negro Brut (187ML Split)
Lucky U IPA
class2.description:
We like to think this is an ale for everyone who believes you make your own luck. We sure did. And the result is a well-balanced, soulful IPA with just the right amount of hoppiness. An even keeled ale that goes down clean and refreshing, but still lets you know it’s been doted on by the Brewmaster. It's true to it’s IPA heritage, but also highly drinkable. Lucky U. And we seriously mean that.

Yeast: Top Fermented Ale Yeast
Malts: Two Row Pale, Munich, Carmel, Torrified Wheat
Hops: Amarillo, Magnum, Perle, Cascade, Apollo, Fuggle, Goldings

class2.name: Bronx Autumn PA
class2.description:
Fresh juice pressed from New York State apples makes up a quarter of the fermentables of this crips and easy-drinking Autumn Pale Ale, lending it a slightly acidic, fruity and tannic finish.  Northern Brewer hops from the west coast are added to the kettle and conditioning tank, contributing a woody and subtle mint character.  

Malt bill:  Briess Pilsen Malt, Briess Special Roast
Hop bill:  Northern Brewer
Apple varieties:  Idared, Crispin, Gala, Stayman-Winesap, Macintosh from Soons Orchard, NY

class2.name: Fess Parker Santa Rita Hills Pinot Noir 2013
Domaine de la Quilla Muscadet Sevre et Maine 2015
Cowboy Common
class2.description: Similar in style to a steam beer, our Cowboy Common uses a traditional lager yeast but is fermented warm at ale temperatures.  Norther Brewer hops offer a woody/minty taste to balance the bready Victory malt.

class2.name: Domaines Bunan Bandol Mas de la Rouviere Rose 2016
Mathilde Chapoutier Cotes de Provence Rose 2016
Cooter Brown
class2.description:
Cooter Brown was a family man who lived on the mason-dixon line during the civil war.  He decided to stay inebriated for the entire war so that he would not need to pick a side. We salute his peaceful manner by naming our brew in his honor.

 

Jekyll Brewing’s Cooter Brown is an American Brown Ale that is smoother than silk.  As you bring our Cooter Brown to your lips, you will smell deep roasty caramel notes as our creamy head embraces your stache.  Once you taste Cooter Brown, you will experience a deep chocolate maltiness and an American hop bitterness balanced to perfection.

class2.name: Ken Wright Cellars Canary Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (375ML) 2015
Joel Gott Blend No. 815 Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Carpe Noctem
class2.description:
Many of history’s most important revolutions began at night, and this beer is brewed to salute those that “Seize the Night” and make it one for the history books! 

CARPE NOCTEM is a black-as-night oatmeal coffee stout with roasted grain aroma and bold coffee character from coffee beans from East Sac’s famous “Chocolate Fish Coffee Roasters.” 

Chocolate and carafa malts present a slight sweetness and mild roastiness with earthy, nutty tones together with a creamy body from locally grown oatmeal. 

So pour yourself a glass of this bad boy and start your own revolution tonight!

class2.name: Parducci True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah 2014
Zeus Will Smite Thee
class2.description: Zeus is a full flavored well balanced IPA. Pale Ale and rye malt provide the backbone of this beer while a blend of Galena, Zythos and Ahtanum hops give it a balanced citrus tangerine flavor.

class2.name: Kai
class2.description: Brewed with Grapefruit and Ginger this refreshing summer ale is sure to please and pair at any summer party be it Bar-B-Que or a fine gathering of friends.

class2.name: Crossbuck
class2.description: 2016 FSB Member Homebrew Competition overall winner brewed by Larry Hutson. Roasty stout bittered with Horizon and late-hopped with Cascade. Conditioned on Black Swan white oak for six weeks. Presents a roasted nose, hopppy middle, and a dry, oak-tannin finish.

class2.name: Geyser Peak Walking Tree Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Artemis Cabernet Sauvignon (375ML half-bottle) 2013
The Astounding She Monster Mango IPA
class2.description: Our juiciest beer features ripe mango and tropical hop aroma on the nose followed by a mild bitterness from the Citra and Falconer's Flight hops and some alcohol warmth to balance out the sweetness of the fresh mango.

class2.name: Famille Perrin Reserve Cotes du Rhone Rouge 2014
Oktoberfest
class2.description:
The Oktoberfest or Marzen (March) type of beer was originally brewed in March, and laid down in caves before the summer weather rendered brewing impossible. Stocks would be drawn upon heavily during the summer, and exhausted by October.

In Germany, this tradition has come to be associated with one specific style, Oktoberfest Bier. In keeping with true German tradition, August Schell Oktoberfest beer is brewed just once a year. Brewed with the perfect balance of Pale, Munich, and Cara Pils malt with Liberty and Perle hops to create a rich, smooth taste.

class2.name: Black Ice
class2.description: A light-bodied, crisp and refreshing American Ale.  Brewed to feature a subtle malt sweetness complimented by mild floral hops.  The combination is a well balanced light-bodied and refreshing ale.  Originally released for the 2016 Black Ice Pond Hockey Tournament in Concord, NH.

class2.name: Ginger Hop IPA
class2.description: Hops and ginger combine in this interesting take on an IPA. This beer is hopped with Sarachi Ace hops to provide lemon notes which blend well with the character that the multiple additions of ginger add!

class2.name: Veuve Clicquot Brut Yellow Label (375ML half-bottle)
Patient Cottat Le Grand Caillou Pinot Noir 2013
Louis Latour Montagny Premier Cru La Grande Roche 2015
Frog's Leap Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc 2015
Holiday Toffee Ale
class2.description: An Amber Belgian Ale hopped with Cluster and Santiam cheer. Rich malt body comprised of Canadian Honey malt and English Marris Otter malt. We let this seasonal beauty simmer with dark Belgian candy sugar and chocolate covered toffees from River Street Sweets in Savannah.

class2.name: Shannon Ridge High Elevation Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Weissbier Dunkel
class2.description: Andechser Weissbier Dunkel has been the perfect completion to the Andechs monastery brewery’s range of products since 1997. This dark Weissbier retains its aromatic character thanks to the select choice of Hallertau aroma hops and highest quality Bavarian wheat and dark barley malts. Its characteristic, distinctive maroon colour is a feast for the eyes. Then there’s the opalescence and fine structure of the yeast turbidity. The perfect complement is provided by the very creamy, fine pored head. This dark Weissbier from the Holy Mountain will delight connoisseurs with a harmonious interplay of fruity odours, above all ripe bananas and pineapple, with undertones of caramel and cocoa. Andechser Weissbier Dunkel teases the tongue with a delicate tanginess carried by a round, soft body. A light caramel sweetness harmonises well with the fine hoppy bitterness. It concludes on a soft and refreshing note (original extract: 12.5%, abv: 5.0%).

class2.name: American Graffiti
class2.description:
Big hop aroma from a large dry hop of Equinox after barrel aging in Scotch Barrels. Notes of citrus, tropical fruit, floral and herbal characteristics very dry and light bodied, tart finish.

Yeast: French saison, Brett. Brux., Lacto Delbrueckii, American Ale.

class2.name: Split Rock Creek Pale Ale
class2.description:
Split Rock Creak Pale Ale is our interpretation of an American Pale Ale.

Our brew is named after the cold creek that Judge Brookings fell into on that fateful night. Wooden Legs Brewing company created Split Rock Creek Pale Ale as a refreshing, yet hoppy brew that leads our Flagship fleet. 

We start with 2-Row American malt and add a few touches of caramel malt to balance out the flavor. The malts bring a great pale golden color with great white head. 

Not to be forgotten, the hops come out strong in the flavor of the classic American Cascades with hints of floral, a touch of spice and a dash of citrus. Late in the boil we add the brewer favorite Amarillo hops to give Split Rock Creek that little extra punch of citrus. 

We use a classic American ale yeast that ferments dry, smooth and clean for that well balanced taste.

class2.name: Sella & Mosca Cannonau di Sardegna Riserva 2011
Pale Ale
class2.description:
Tap Room No. 21 Pale Ale holds the code to unlocking the mystery of the 1920’s speakeasies. With its balanced flavor, this Pale Ale offers a true taste of American history. No secret handshakes or passwords needed to enjoy this fine ale. Just pop the top and celebrate the repeal of prohibition.

A true Pale Ale. Balanced Cascade, Amarillo and Tomahawk hops create a citrusy aroma with a clean, crisp finish. The hops give way to a light malt flavor producing a traditional reddish amber hue.

class2.name: Four Star Pils
class2.description: This golden-hued pilsner has a light, fresh body and clean finish. Bright, refreshing carbonation mingles with German and American hops to give this pilsner a unique Goose Island spin.

class2.name: Toad Hollow Risque French Sparkling Wine
Scarlet o’ Bretta
class2.description: Drake’s interpretation of a Flanders style sour beer, aged in Chardonnay barrels from Wente in Livermore and inoculated with a blend of house souring cultures to get a mild tartness and traditional funk. The aroma of dark cherries, currants, wine and oak melts with a malt sweetness and Brett funk. On the tongue, the tartness is more apparent, hitting you first, but giving way to a pleasant malt sweetness with hints of cherry cola and Chardonnay.

class2.name: Menage a Trois Silk Soft Red Blend 2015
Whiskey-Vanilla Smoked Porter
class2.description: A dark, rich, slightly thick porter infused with a classic bourbon flavor. This specialty dark ale is sure to please even the most discriminating palate.

class2.name: Smoky Bob
class2.description: In Northeast Bavaria, one of the local specialties is Rauch, or smoked, Beer.  We decided that it would be fun to see what we could do with this style.  While not as smoky as some beers from Germany, this beer shows a little smokiness in the nose, along with some malty notes (there were no finishing hops in this beer, so no hop aroma).  On the palate, the malt and smoke interplay with each other, with the dextrins combining with the smoke to bring out an almost bacon-y flavor.  The finish is crisp and savory, inviting you back for another sip.  (1.014 BG, 5.25%, 25 IBU, 9 SRM)

class2.name: Dirty Amber Ale
class2.description: A crisp, smooth ale for the masses. Carefully selected malts combined with Centennial and Cascade Hops come together to create our flagship beer.

class2.name: Horizon Red Ale
class2.description: Horizon Red Ale – an emerging American hybrid ale that crosses the boundaries of styles. This red-hued ale projects an intensity of complex hops – yet allows the drinker to experience the balance and character of the malt. Floral, dry, hoppy and satisfying. Beautifully dry hopped, Horizon Red Ale will be considered a classic.

class2.name: Craggy Range Winery Te Muna Road Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc 2016
Domaine Pichot Vouvray Domaine Le Peu de la Moriette 2015
Appalachian Amber Ale
class2.description:
Thomas Creek Amber is a full-bodied ale with malty flavor, rich caramel color, and a smooth aromatic finish. 

Malts: 2 Row Pale, Carapils, Carmel 40, Carmel 60, Black Patent
Hops: Hallertauer, Tettenger, East Kent Golding

Silver - 2008 Carolinas Championship of Beers
Gold - 2006 Carolinas Championship of Beers
Silver - 2003 Carolinas Championship of Beers

class2.name: Shaughnessy Stout
class2.description: An opaque black, full bodied Irish ale. Roasted coffee aroma, chocolate notes, dry finish

class2.name: Lake Sonoma Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel 2012
Summer Bock
class2.description: Rich in flavor from German pale barley. Moderate noble hop character with a subtle spicy quality from hops and alcohol. German Lager yeast provides a smooth long clean finish that interplays the malt and noble hops.

class2.name: Shannon Ridge High Elevation Petite Sirah 2015
Belgian Amber
class2.description: This striking Belgian Style Amber ale gets its color and flavor from over six varieties of malted barley. Toasted malt dominates the flavor profile, but subtle sweetness lingers to provide a rich mouth feel that is extremely smooth and drinkable.

class2.name: Smoked Porter
class2.description: A porter-style beer brewed with an addition of German smoked malt. Medium bodied with a hint of smoke on the finish, this beer pairs great with bbq and meat dishes.

class2.name: Daypack
class2.description: Daypack is a hoppy pale ale inspired by the beers we love to take with us on long hikes and treks with one end goal, hoppy refreshment. With a malt bill consisting solely of our base two-row malt, and Marris Otter pale ale malt from England, Daypack remains bone dry with a background of simple bready notes. Its Citra heavy dry hop creates a medley of tropical and dank flavors that jump right out of the beer, only to be followed up with hoppy notes of Asian pear and orange zest. Truly a pale ale best paired with a sunny day.

class2.name: Alice
class2.description: Alice has quickly become a favorite of staff and customers at our original Brooklyn Neighborhood location. The cider is made entirely from estate grown Granny Smith apples. The result is a clean, crisp, tart cider that can appeal to just about any customer.

class2.name: Vanilla Bean Buffalo Sweat
class2.description: Vanilla Bean Buffalo Sweat is a combination of our award-winning oatmeal cream stout, Buffalo Sweat, with whole Ugandan vanilla beans. The result is the natural espresso-chocolate flavors of Buffalo Sweat infused with the sweetness of vanilla. It’s an exceptional treat on a cold winter’s night.

class2.name: Oaked Maple
class2.description:
Fermented with raisins and oak chips, this semi-dry cider is back-sweetened with pure Vermont maple syrup. Offering notes of vanilla and oak with a hint of maple, this unique cider is the perfect accompaniment to chilly winter weather. 

APPLES: Smith, Fuji, Red Delicious, Golden Delicious, Gala

class2.name: Wild VIII
class2.description: Oak-Aged Wild Ale with Brettanomyces and Cherries.

class2.name: J. Lohr Bay Mist White Riesling 2015
Escape Artist
class2.description: We believe beer is magic! Escape Artist Extra Special Pale will make you a believer as well. A light, medium-bodied brew, we use two classic American hops varieties. Centennial and Cascade create a concoction of mystique and complexity. No smoke and mirrors here.

class2.name: The Big Fella
class2.description: A West Coast spin on a traditional Irish Red Ale, named after Founding Father of the Irish Freedom Movement, Michael Collins. “The Big Fella” balances mellow caramel sweetness with a distinctly West-Coast American hoppiness in this full-bodied copper red ale.

class2.name: Pilsner
class2.description: Czech out Redhook’s newest brew.  Redhook Pilsner is crisp, golden lager that is modeled after those historic beers originally made in Plzeň, Czechoslovakia.  Redhook Pilsner’s maltiness is offset by a medium dose of Saaz hops and finishes with a clean, bright, thirst-quenching quality. A great “session” lager for when you’ve got a long day ahead of drinking.

class2.name: Tres Carnales – Pan American IPA
class2.description:
Once upon a time in Mexico 3 brewers met. They shared a common passion. Their love for exceptional craft beer. Over time the brewers became good friends. One day they decided to put their collective beer knowledge together.  Their quest was to create 1 truly outstanding beer. Introducing ìTres Carnalesî. 3 minds. 3 friends. 

1 beautifully crafted beer.

 

With the perfect blend of American and Mexican brewing influence this Pan American IPA is pale orange with copper highlights. The hop character explodes with Mandarin orange aromatics and resinous pine undertones. All from copious amounts of Mandarina Bavaria and Centennial hops.  The malt character is slightly bready. Youíll find mild hints of sweet and tart from the addition of select Blue Agave and Hibiscus flowers. The finish is dry with an assertive yet elegantly refined bitterness from German Magnum hops. 

°salud!

class2.name: Restoration Pale Ale
class2.description: Abita Restoration Pale Ale was created after the back-to-back hurricanes devastated Louisiana. With your help, the abita Brewing Company raised over $500,000 for hurricane relief. This brilliant, golden pale ale has a rich body, mild bitterness and a snappy, fresh citrus hop flavor and aroma. Cold filtered and brewed in small batches using no additives or preservatives, the Abita Company is proud to be Louisiana True.

class2.name: Scratch #46 Naked Elf (2011)
class2.description:
Naked Elf is an exercise in deconstruction and minimalism. This ale has distinct roots in The Mad Elf minus some key components.

The cherries? Gone. 
The honey? Gone. 
The chocolate malt? Gone.

Coming in just under 8% ABV, Naked Elf is an unfiltered golden beauty that displays a pronounced yeast flavor that made The Mad Elf famous as well as a touch of alcohol and some mellow malt flavors.

O.G.: 22 
Malt: Pils, Munich, Crystal 
Yeast: Belgian 
Hops: German Northern Brewers, Czech Saaz

class2.name: Vienna Lager
class2.description: Our interpretation of the classic Vienna lager - pale amber in color, medium bodied, ever so slightly toasty from Munich and Vienna malts, complimented by a grassy noble hop nose.

class2.name: Harvest Pale Ale
class2.description: A medium bodied, deep golden ale with a distinctive aroma and refreshing flavor. Dry-hopping with Cascade and Centennial hops produces a beer with a delightful balance of natural sweetness and assertive hop finish.

class2.name: Superstitious Stout
class2.description: This dry Irish stout pours with a creamy "Guinness" style head. Bitter and roast notes peak through this light bodied beer, making it a highly drinkable stout.

class2.name: Blood Orange Wheat Ale
class2.description: New to our Pub Series, this beer is brewed with 2-row Northwest Pale, Malted Wheat, and Unmalted Wheat. Blood orange provides a subtle twist to this refreshing brew. It pours with a white lacy head and a hint of orange aroma. A medium malt body with a crisp wheat finish and subtle orange flavor. Blood Orange Wheat Ale is available in six packs, on draft and in our Full Sail Trophy Case variety 12-pack from April to August.

class2.name: Cristom Mt. Jefferson Cuvee Pinot Noir 2014
Batasiolo Moscato d'Asti Bosc dla Rei 2016
Merry Buffing Christmas
class2.description:
Piney and resinous with a bit of spice from the rye, you'll want this beer full of holiday cheer and our Christmas present to Houston: a rye IPA with spruce tips.

It's dank with a subtle citrus nose. Fresh spruce tips give a strong pine forward flavor and Chinook and Amarillo hops meld with the rye to brighten up the finish with a nice bit of spice.

class2.name: I Giusti and Zanza Nemorino Rosso 2014
El Despierto Coffee Porter
class2.description:
In Early 2015, Busted Sandal Brewing decided to work on a project to develop a coffee porter that was unlike other coffee porters. Something with substance, where the craft of coffee brewing and the craft of beer brewing were perfectly matched into one delicious drink. After some research, we sought out and established a partnership with The Brown Coffee Company, in San Antonio, Texas.

We quickly learned from Founder and “Coffee Hunter” Aaron Blanco that Brown is not just special, it is unique in its market. You see, Aaron sources his coffee beans for his craft roasting by establishing direct relationships with coffee farmers around the world. He travels to farms and stays with farmers, and regularly hosts them in San Antonio. He seeks out the best of the best coffees, understanding the unique environment and character of each coffee variety where it is grown, as well as which processing methods best suit which coffees, all in pursuit of the perfect cup.

While Brown works diligently to be as transparent and “invisible” as possible in selecting, roasting and serving their coffees, when it comes to our El Despierto Coffee Porter, it is anything but invisible. The coffee in El Despierto comes from the Madan Estate in the Western Highlands of Papua New Guinea. It is a huge coffee with a deep, spicy, tobacco leaf sweetness that converges perfectly with our beer to create something special. Unique. El Despierto is an amazing beer with amazing ingredients that we are sure you will love.

class2.name: Black Yeti
class2.description: This Stout has a load of late hop additions to bring that zest and poke to the nose. Beautiful delicate coffee and chocolate notes lie in the smooth character of the malts.

class2.name: Albatross Pale Ale
class2.description: You’ve heard of a Birdie. Even an Eagle or a Hole In One. But what about an Albatross? That’s three shots under Par; as rare as the Albatross itself. Matt Swihart teamed up with some folks from Point Blank Distributing to put together a refreshing pale ale. It sits light on the tongue, and finishes dry and refreshing. Lemon and raspberry sit on the top, and it continues a light effervescence accented with citrus and a lemon tanginess. There wasn’t much made. You might say it’s as rare as an Albatross.

class2.name: Buxom Blonde
class2.description: This Belgian Abby style is well proportioned, soft, and beautiful like the name suggests. Nice fruity tones, to compliment this beers body, and healthily hoped and well proportioned.

class2.name: Antinori Villa Antinori Chianti Classico Riserva 2012
Le Rose de Phelan Segur Rose Bordeaux 2007
Not So Old Bohemian Pilsner
class2.description: Pilsner and Vienna malts make this a true craft lager  (yea, yea, we know it’s the yeast that makes it a lager); you won’t find corn or rice in this Bohemian-style Lager.  In true Bohemian style, this light lager is brewed with Czech Saaz hops.  One of our lightest brews, this one is especially made for drinking all summer long.

class2.name: Galaxy
class2.description:
Style: Single Hopped Saison 
Brewing single hopped Saisons gives us the opportunity to focus on the unique qualities of one hop and we are able to accentuate the best characteristics of that single ingredient. Galaxy hops are known for their tropical fruit flavors, so we added passion fruit juice, just for fun!

class2.name: Never Say Die Rye
class2.description:
Where civilization is established rye will follow. In early farming communities rye was considered a weed of the wheat crops that maintained entire villages. When rye was discovered to be a nutritious and hardy grain its cultivation became more purposeful.
A hazy golden straw color and eggshell white head parade our rye session ale onto the scene with old fashioned gusto. Holding true to its historical character a spice snap is presented with the first sips and continues throughout. This beer is full and round in mouth feel; a slight hint of bitter sweet orange pith softening the rye and provides balance. A crisp and very dry finish reiterates the rye spice and pleases the palate. Cheers!

class2.name: Jan
class2.description: Bavaria, Floral, Mandarin, Bi-Lingual.

class2.name: Stellar Ghirardelli Gift Basket
class2.description:
A dazzling array of San Francisco's most heavenly chocolates! This gold star gift box is bursting with rich and dreamy chocolates. From Ghirardelli's most popular chocolate squares and bars to hot cocoa mix, this gift shines!

Gift Includes:
  • Ghirardelli Double Chocolate Hot Cocoa (2) 0.85 oz
  • Ghirardelli Dark & Sea Salt Caramel Bar 3.5 oz
  • Ghirardelli Milk Chocolate Caramel Bar 3.5 oz
  • Ghirardelli Milk Chocolate with Caramel Squares (2) .37 oz
  • Ghirardelli Dark Chocolate Square .37oz

Please note that due to the popularity of this product, in some cases we may need to substitute items of equal or greater quality.

class2.name: Warrior
class2.description: Warrior Black Ale is a well-hopped "India black ale." Judicious use of debittered roasted barley give Warrior it's distinctive black hue, while leaving a gentle roast in the finish. Filled with sticky Pacific Northwest hops in the kettle and then dry hopped generously with Columbus, Summit, and Amarillo for a resinous nose. Warrior is a collaborative effort with our good friend Noah Regnery, the award-winning brewer from Pizza Port San Clemente.

class2.name: Fatted Calf Sacrificial Stout
class2.description: A seven grain Stout masterpiece on nitro! Rolled oats and soft wheat give our Dry Stout a smoothness that compliments chocolate malts. This Nitrogen infused ale is a Prodigal Son original – enjoy!

class2.name: Old World India Pale Ale
class2.description:
This bottle contains an India Pale Ale from a bygone era. An era of towering sailing ships, burgeoning empires and world shaping beers. This is an ale hand crafted with British malts and English hops to recreate the epic IPAs that were sent on monumental ocean voyages from England to India by sea in the 1800s.

Old World IPA is an attempt by punk post modern Scottish Brewers to pay tribute to a 200 year old odyssey and heritage with a healthy dose of swash-buckling adventure.

class2.name: Zaccagnini Il Vino Dal Tralcetto Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2014
Hoppelganger IPA
class2.description: R&B’s Hoppelganger IPA is a Northwest style India Pale Ale, created for the true beer connoisseur. An assertive blend of Crystal, Columbus, Chinook, Mt. Hood, and Cascade Hops, is added to premium English, French-Belgian, and Canadian malts to create a fresh floral aroma and generous malt flavour, so emblematic of true Northwest-style I.P.A.s. Hoppelganger’s clean and slightly sweet finish is followed by an aggressive hop bitterness. At 45 IBU’s, this beer is definitely…NOT FOR THE FAINT OF TONGUE!!!

class2.name: Altenauer Frühlingserwachen
class2.description: In our Altenauer springbok, hop-aromatic freshness is combined with a touch of malty sweetness. Aromamalts give it its reddish color and sweetness, which spreads pleasantly on the tongue. The finest aroma pots provide a harmonious citrus freshness in the antrunk. These exquisite ingredients make the Altenauer Springbok a unique Harz beer specialty.

class2.name: Bootlegger Brown
class2.description: Smooth, chocolatey, and easy-drinking.... Brewed with the finest two-row barley and Belgian chocolate malt, Bootlegger has a distinctive, chocolatey flavor. Bootlegger is medium-bodied and filtered for a clean, laid-back finish.

class2.name: RYE FACTOR RED
class2.description: A deep copper colored ale w/ medium body & bitterness, subtle smoked flavors from the use of cherrywood smoked malt

class2.name: Innocent Bystander Yarra Valley Pinot Noir 2015
Crows Foot
class2.description: As many sailors were barefoot, pirates would toss this multi pronged steel weapon on to the deck of the ship they were attacking, causing chaos. Hints of roasted barley, coffee, chocolate and acidic funk pierce your palate in this light bodied, dry, black ale.

class2.name: La Braccesca Vino Nobile di Montepulciano 2012
Replicale
class2.description: Straw color, orange rind aroma, apricot flavor, medium body. Illinois Craft Brewers Guild inspired recipe that was brewed  for the Guild and their loyal patrons.

class2.name: The Harry Oyster Stout
class2.description: 480 Willapa Bay oysters smooths out the roast profile of this Irish Dry Stout for a truly sublime drinking experience. This beer is an Agrarian Ales and Corvallis Brewing Supply collaboration with oysters from Harry and Annette's Fish Market.

class2.name: Paienne (Pagan)
class2.description: Paienne is a top-fermenting June straw blond coloured beer. It presents aromas of malt, fruits and hops. Its well-balanced flavours are dominated by malty and fresh cereals tastes, completed by a delicate bitterness. All of this makes the Paienne an inviting and thirst-quenching beer offering at the same time satisfying tastes and a generous body.

class2.name: Pinedrops
class2.description: This West Coast IPA is like that sweet little Nordic trail off the main trail of Meissner - it takes the high road. Using Pilsner base malt, it is light on malt but not hops. With a hop bill consisting of Amarillo, Centennial, Northern Brewer, and experimental hop X, we packed in the pine along with the citrus notes we love.

class2.name: Smoked Lager
class2.description: Our slightly smoked Helles-style lager contains all American ingredients including Briess malt smoked with cherry wood. Rich malts and smooth hops give way to a smoky finish reminiscent of the old Bamberg style rauch biers.

class2.name: Frankenlager
class2.description:
In Mary Shelley’s novel, a modern-day Prometheus combines disparate parts to create something uncontrollable, destructive and misunderstood. Lucky for you (and our team) that brewing is much more predictable and manageable, especially in our new state-of-the-art brewery in Hampton, NH.
The India-style Pale Lager is a new hybrid-style of beer that’s begun surfacing throughout the craft brewing nations of the world. Frankenlager is Smuttynose’s presentation of a double IPA mashed and fermented like the classic lagers of Europe. Crisp and refined, but certainly not meek or mild, Frankenlager is one the first beers brewed in our new home and we’re excited to present it to the world.

class2.name: Hail the Pale
class2.description: Hail The Pale is our interpretation of the American Pale Ale. It mostly comprises pale malt, but also includes some caramel malt for a touch of sweetness. It is hopped with Simcoe, a hop that we have not used in any of our other beers, which lends its unique flavor and strong floral aroma.

class2.name: 1060 EZ
class2.description: Brewed for tax day each year, 1060 EZ is a high gravity golden ale brewed with flaked corn, whose deep golden color and aroma of corn grits complements the light body and flavor notes of cornbread and honey.

class2.name: I-10
class2.description: The West Coast comes to Jax with this extremely hoppy, true India Pale Ale. Our two-row malted barley and caramel malt come to life with a ?@!#-ton of Northwest hops. We use 4 different hops during the brewing process and during dry hopping. It’s music to your nose.

class2.name: Grateful Red
